results.name: Numerator of 2*n*A000111(n-1)/A000111(n): approximations of Pi, using Euler (up/down) numbers.
comment: The denominators are given in A132050.
reference: J.-P. Delahaye, Pi - die Story (German translation), Birkhäuser, 1999 Basel, p. 31. French original: Le fascinant nombre Pi, Pour la Science, Paris, 1997.
link: Leonhard Euler, On the sums of series of reciprocals, (Presented to the St. Petersburg Academy on December 5, 1735), last paragraph, arXiv:math/0506415v2 [math.HO]. [Peter Luschny, Nov 18 2008]
Wolfdieter Lang, Rationals and some values
formula: a(n)=numerator(r(n)) with the rationals r(n)=2*n*e(n-1)/e(n), where e(n)=A000111(n) ("zig-zag" or "up-down" numbers), i.e., e(2*k)=A000364(k) (Euler numbers, secant numbers, "zig"-numbers) and e(2*k+1)=A000182(k+1),k>=0, (tangent numbers, "zag"-numbers). Rationals in lowest terms.
maple: if k=0 then `if`(n=0,1,0) else S(n,k-1)+S(n-1,n-k) fi end:
mathematica: e[n_] := If[EvenQ[n], Abs[EulerE[n]], Abs[(2^(n+1)*(2^(n+1) - 1)*BernoulliB[n+1])/(n+1)]]; r[n_] := 2*n*(e[n-1]/e[n]); a[n_] := Numerator[r[n]]; Table[a[n], {n, 3, 22}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 18 2013 *)
xref: Cf. triangle A008281 (main diagonal give zig-zag numbers A000111), A223925.
